info.title: CoolerControl Daemon API
info.description: Basic OpenAPI documentation for the CoolerControl Daemon API

get.description: A simple endpoint to verify the connection

400.description: Bad Request. The request is invalid

404.description: Whatever you're looking for, it's not here.

502.description: Bad Gateway. An error has occurred with an external library.

get.description: This returns all recent main daemon logs as raw text

post.description: Sends a cancellation signal to shut the daemon down. When the daemon is running as a systemd or initrc service, it is automatically restarted.

get.description: Subscribes and returns the Server Sent Events for a Log stream
Subscribes and returns the Server Sent Events for a Status stream

CookieAuth.name: cc
CookieAuth.description: The private session cookie used for authentication.

BasicAuth.description: HTTP Basic authentication, mostly used to generate a secure authentication cookie.

disable.description: All communication with this device will be avoided if disabled

name.description: The device name for this setting. Helpful after blacklisting(disabling) devices.

id.description: ID MUST be unique, as `temp_name` must be unique.

temp_max.description: The maximum temp to use for Profiles for this device

temp_min.description: The minimum temp to use for Profiles for this device

thinkpad_fan_control.description: When present, then this is a `ThinkPad` device. True or False indicates whether Fan control is enabled for the kernel module and changing values is possible

locations.description: If available various paths used to access the device. This can include paths like the kernel device path, hwmon path, HID path, or PCI Bus ID

name.description: If available the kernel driver name or liquidctl driver class.

version.description: If available the driver's version. For kernel-based drivers this is the current kernel version. For liquidctl-based drivers this is the liquidctl version. For Nvidia-based drivers this is the version of the installed nvidia proprietary drivers.

DriverType.description: The Driver Type, or source of the driver actively being used for this device.

deviance.description: The temperature deviance threshold in degrees

duty_maximum.description: The maximum duty change to apply

duty_minimum.description: The minimum duty change to apply

name.description: The user given name for this function

only_downward.description: Whether to apply settings only on the way down

sample_window.description: The sample window this function should use, particularly applicable to moving averages

uid.description: The Unique identifier for this function

driver_type.description: An Enum representation of the various Liquidctl driver classes

firmware_version.description: The detected firmware version at initialization

unknown_asetek.description: An indicator for needed user input to determine actual asetek690lc device

colors.description: a list of RGB tuple values, eg [(20,20,120), (0,0,255)]

image_file_processed.description: The LCD Image tmp file path location, where the preprocessed image is located

temp_source.description: A temp source for displaying a temperature.

colors.description: a list of RGB tuple values, eg [(20,20,120), (0,0,255)]

function_uid.description: The function uid to apply to this profile

member_profile_uids.description: The profiles that make up the mix profile

mix_function_type.description: The function to mix the members with if this is a Mix Profile

name.description: The User given name for this Profile

speed_fixed.description: The fixed duty speed to set. eg: 20 (%)

speed_profile.description: The profile temp/duty speeds to set. eg: [(20.0, 50), (25.7, 80)]

uid.description: The Unique Identifier for this Profile

Setting.description: Setting is a passed struct used to store applied Settings to a device channel Usually only one specific lighting or speed setting is applied at a time.

profile_uid.description: The Profile UID that applies to this device channel

pwm_mode.description: the current `pwm_mode` to set for hwmon devices, eg: 1

reset_to_default.description: Used to set hwmon & nvidia channels back to their default 'automatic' values.

speed_fixed.description: The fixed duty speed to set. eg: 20 (%)

fixed_enabled.description: If this is false, it means the fans are not controllable, but viewable.

manual_profiles_enabled.description: This enables software-profiles for device-internal temperatures External temperatures must always be software-profiles and are not handled by this property

max_duty.description: The maximum fan duty for this speed channel

min_duty.description: The minimum fan duty for this speed channel

profiles_enabled.description: If (temp, duty) profiles are supported by the device natively or not (device-internal temps)

Status.description: A Model which contains various applicable device statuses

device_uid.description: The associated device uid containing current temp values

temp_name.description: The internal name for this Temperature Source. NOT the `TempInfo` Label.
